intro: Oncosiphon, commonly known as the golden weed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are often finely divided and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Oncosiphon species are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
